pages.text: Henodus chelyops was a placodont reptile that lived during the Late Triassic in what is now southern Germany. It is the only placodont so far discovered in non-marine deposits, suggesting it lived in brackish or freshwater lagoons. Specialized baleen-like denticles in the animal's mouth suggest it fed by scraping off and filtering algae from the mud.
